name: treatment of bottom ash, MSWI-WWT, condensate from light oil boiler, slag compartment | bottom ash, MSWI-WWT, condensate from light oil boiler | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/26967/documentation

The process represents the treatment of a waste (bottom ash) that is exclusively generated from another waste treatment. Bottom ash is generated in the municipal solid waste incineration (MSWI) of sewage sludge (with 70% water) that in turn is generated from wastewater treatment (WWT) of 'condensate from light oil boiler'. Recommended use of this dataset: to be used within the specific chain of treatments for 'condensate from light oil boiler'. Share of biogenic carbon in the sludge: 0%.

The activity starts with the waste being available at the gate of the treatment facility. Collection and transportation of the waste to the treatment plant is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being treated and waste-specific emissions from the slag compartment landfill are released to water (short-term emissions to surface water and long-term emissions to ground water).
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Modelling parameters affecting the treatment technology are not specific to this geography.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Slag compartment for bottom ashes from incineration with base seal and leachate collection system. Recultivation after closure.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Modelling parameters are based on an average slag compartment landfill in Switzerland.
